text: Jeotgalicoccus halophilus is a species of bacteria. Wen-Yan Liu, Lin-Lin Jiang, Chun-Jing Guo and Su Sheng Yang. Jeotgalicoccus halophilus sp. nov., isolated from salt lakes In: International journal of systematic and evolutionary microbiology Volume 61, no. 7, Juli 2011, S. 1720â€“1724. Link It belongs to the family Staphylococcaceae. It is gram-positive. The cells are coccoid. The species is halotolerant. It grows at NaCl content of 0.1 to 16%. ==References== Category:Gram-positive bacteria
title: Jeotgalicoccus halophilus
